intro: Cryptopus brachiatus, commonly known as the branched cryptopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
